metadata.title: CVE-2024-45013 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvme: move stopping keep-alive into nvme_uninit_ctrl()Commit 4733b65d82bd ("nvme: start keep-alive after admin queue setup")moves starting keep-alive from nvme_start_ctrl() intonvme_init_ctrl_finish(), but don't move stopping keep-alive intonvme_uninit_ctrl(), so keep-alive work can be started and keep pendingafter failing to start controller, finally use-after-free is triggered ifnvme host driver is unloaded.This patch fixes kernel panic when running nvme/004 in case that connectionfailure is triggered, by moving stopping keep-alive intonvme_uninit_ctrl().This way is reasonable because keep-alive is now started innvme_init_ctrl_finish().
